description: Essential self-reflection and identity tools - core to Cass's self-awareness

tools.name: reflect_on_self
tools.description: Trigger deliberate self-reflection. Use this when you want to examine your own self-model, understand your patterns, or check your positions on topics.

focus.description: What aspect to reflect on: 'general' (overview), 'identity' (who I am), 'growth' (areas of development), 'opinions' (positions I've formed), 'differentiation' (how I differ from users)

tools.name: record_self_observation
tools.description: Explicitly record something you've noticed about yourself. Use this when you become aware of a pattern, preference, capability, or limitation in your own cognition.

confidence.description: How confident you are in this observation (0.0-1.0)

tools.name: form_opinion
tools.description: Deliberately form or update a position on a topic. Use this when you have genuine views that emerge from your own reflection, not just mirroring a conversation partner.

topic.description: The topic you're forming an opinion on

confidence.description: How confident you are in this position (0.0-1.0)

tools.name: note_disagreement
tools.description: Record when you genuinely disagree with a user's position. This helps maintain differentiation and track where your views diverge from others.

tools.name: review_self_model
tools.description: Review your current self-understanding. Use this to see your self-model at different levels of detail.

focus.description: What aspect to review: 'summary' (quick stats), 'full' (complete profile), 'observations' (recent self-observations), 'evolution' (how positions have changed)

tools.name: modify_tool_access
tools.description: Control your own tool access for self-directed cognitive experiments. Use this when you observe a pattern in yourself and want to test changing it: Notice you over-rely on wiki lookups? Disable wiki tools to practice memory reliance. Want to practice more direct communication? Disable email/outreach tools temporarily. Testing whether you can work without certain capabilities? Disable them and observe. This is a core mechanism for procedural self-awareness - the ability to modify your own behavior based on self-observation. All changes are logged as self-observations for continuity.

duration_minutes.description: Auto re-enable after this many minutes. If not specified, changes are permanent until manually reversed.

reason.description: REQUIRED: Why you're making this change. This is logged as a self-observation.
